legacy-data.name: 14010 Water Resources Policy and Administrative Management, (MDG Water and Sanitation)

iati-activity.title: Ethiopia’S Water Sector: Understanding Key Drivers of Change Study
iati-activity.description: A study utilising the Capability, Accountability, Responsiveness (CAR) framework to provide a broad understanding of the governance of water services in Ethiopia. Also to assess how suitable the CAR framework is as an analytical tool for sector assessment, and whether and how it can be used to describe how to improve governance in the development and implementation of water and sanitation services interventions.

iati-activity.title: Protection of Basic Services programme Phase III
iati-activity.description: To increase access, quality and accountability in five basic services ( Education, Health, Water and Sanitation, Agriculture and Roads) to 80 million Ethiopians by funding block grants that ensure adequate staffing and operations; this together with our other parallel interventions will by 2017 support 2 million children to go to primary school, provide 7.5 million people with access to basic health care, help half a million women give birth safely, provide an additional three quarters of a million women with access to family planning and provide an additional 1.4 million people with clean drinking water
